choices.C: Schedule an outage to replace the failed module immediately.
choices.A: Replace the failed module during the next scheduled downtime.
choices.B: Hot swap the failed module immediately.
choices.D: Hot swap the failed module during the next scheduled downtime.

questions.question_text: An administrator is alerted to an issue with server hardware deployed as a virtualization host. The alert indicates a predictive failure in a DIMM module. Which of the following is the BEST action for the administrator to take?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Hot-swapping memory, while possible in some advanced server systems, is not a standard feature across all hardware. It's risky to assume this capability exists without specific knowledge of the system. By scheduling an immediate outage, the administrator is taking a proactive stance to prevent potential data loss or system instability.

Selected Answer: C
Scheduling an outage immediately mitigates the possibility of a catastrophic failure, thus eliminating the inevitable unannounced disruption of services.

Selected Answer: B
B. Hot swap the failed module immediately.

DIMM modules are normally designed to be hot-swappable.
If a DIMM module is expected to fail, it is important to replace the failed module as soon as possible. Hot-swapping (in-service replacement) will minimize service interruptions.

Selected Answer: A
Unless the scheduled downtime is way far, as in they work 24/7, no admin would schedule an immediate outage, disrupt work, for just a predictive failure.

comments.content: I upvoted you, but now that I think about it, it's probably not the answer, unless the scheduled downtime is way far as in they work 24/7, otherwise, no admin would schedule an immediate outage, disrupt work, for just a predictive failure.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Here's why:

It addresses the urgency of the predictive failure alert, reducing the risk of an actual failure occurring.
Scheduling an outage allows for proper planning and notification to affected users or systems.
It ensures the replacement can be done safely, with the system powered down, which is typically necessary for memory replacement.
This approach balances the need for prompt action with the need for controlled, safe maintenance on a critical system.
It allows for proper testing after replacement to ensure system stability.

While scheduling an immediate outage may cause some short-term disruption, it's the safest and most responsible course of action given the critical nature of a virtualization host and the potential consequences of an actual memory failure. This approach minimizes the risk of unplanned downtime or data loss that could result from an actual failure of the DIMM module.

Selected Answer: A
DIMM's can not be hot swappable

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a server issue. The technician has determined several possible causes of the issue and has identified various solutions. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

choices.B: Test each solution individually to determine the root cause, rolling back the changes in between each test.
choices.C: Implement the shortest solution first to identify the issue and minimize downtime.
choices.A: Consult internet forums to determine which is the most common cause and deploy only that solution.
choices.D: Test each solution in succession and restore the server from the latest snapshot.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Test each solution individually to determine the root cause, rolling back the changes in between each test.

questions.question_text: Following a recent power outage, a server in the data center has been constantly going offline and losing its configuration. Users have been experiencing access issues while using the application on the server. The server technician notices the date and time are incorrect when the server is online. All other servers are working. Which of the following would MOST likely cause this issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
. The server has a faulty power supply:

A faulty power supply can lead to unexpected shutdowns or power interruptions, causing the server to go offline. These abrupt shutdowns may result in the loss of configuration settings, including date and time.
B. The server has a CMOS battery failure:

The CMOS battery is responsible for maintaining the system's date and time settings when the server is powered off. If the CMOS battery is failing, it may not be able to retain the date and time information, leading to incorrect settings each time the server is restarted.

choices.A: The server has a faulty power supply.
choices.B: The server has a CMOS battery failure.
choices.F: CPU frequency scaling is set too high.
choices.D: The server has a malfunctioning LED panel.

discussion.content:
Answer is C:
Rack Layout Diagram: This document provides a visual representation of the layout of racks within the data center, including the physical placement of servers within each rack. It helps system administrators and data center personnel quickly locate specific servers by identifying their rack position, unit (U) height, and any relevant labeling or numbering schemes.
